total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the locations of the number 1 in the input grid.
Q2: For each location of 1, check if there are any other 1s in the same row or column.
Q3: If there are other 1s in the same row or column, mark the cells between them as 3.
Q4: If there are no other 1s in the same row or column, mark the cells in the same row or column as 1.
Q5: For the cells that are not marked as 1 or 3, mark them as 2 if they are adjacent to a cell marked as 1, otherwise mark them as the original number.

Q1: Identify the locations of the number 1 in the input grid.
Q2: For each location of 1, check if it is surrounded by 8s in the four cardinal directions (up, down, left, right).
Q3: If a 1 is surrounded by 8s, change the 8s to 1s.
Q4: For each location of 1, check if it is surrounded by 1s in the four cardinal directions (up, down, left, right).
Q5: If a 1 is surrounded by 1s, change the 1s to 2.
Q6: For each location of 1, check if it is surrounded by 2s in the four cardinal directions (up, down, left, right).
Q7: If a 1 is surrounded by 2s, change the 2s to 3.
Q8: Repeat the process until no more changes can be made.
